title: SDK Development Guide
text_01: Hello, this article will introduce you to some common mechanisms and rules of OpenAPI to help you develop SDK. The general content of this article includes:
text_06: In order to ensure that the parameter information you send to ByteTrack is not maliciously modified, ByteTrack provides MD5 digest encryption verification for your interface. The basic encryption parameters you can use: timestamp (timestamp), random string (nonce), signature key (key), request plaintext parameter (body), encrypted by MD5 and converted to lowercase. The basic algorithm format is as follows:
text_08: ‚óè body: request plain text parameters, json string type; for details, please refer to the API interface document
text_09: ‚óè key: your Secret Key, string type; get the Secret Key
text_10: ‚óè nonce: random string, string type; 8 bits recommended;
text_11: ‚óè timestamp: timestamp, string type; unit: milliseconds;
